line_1: Vex'd e'en that Caution should distrust
line_2: Those friends I love, those friends so just,

line_1: She distant Waters eyes with kind Distrust,
line_2: Knows when all's safe, and when her Fears are just.

line_1: If all our safety's founded on distrust;
line_2: What joy for truth, what commerce for the just,

line_1: Have I not wrong'd thee by unkind Distrust?
line_2: Lov'd tho' thou wert, in every Action just,

line_1: And my Affection can no more distrust:
line_2: Perhaps you pity me: I know you must,
Shall in immortal bands unite the just;

line_1: And Love is often banish'd by Distrust.
line_2: Rashly they judge, and always think the worst,

line_1: Are the dire Images of sad Distrust,
line_2: And Popular Change, obscur'd a-mid the Dust,
And PARTY, of all foes the worst,

line_1: And cold reserve and mean distrust,
Tho' well I might your truth distrust,
line_2: My foolish heart believes you just;

line_1: What? does thy Queen, o'er-run with rude distrust,
line_2: Resolve by force to keep a husband just?
